Salesforce Developer

Company Name Open Universities Australia Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 52 views

Job description

We’re in an exciting growth phase transforming online education!

As a result, we have a newly created opportunity for a skilled Salesforce Developer to join the Software Engineering team to design and drive continuous improvement solutions to OUA’s Salesforce platform to deliver value.\xa0


We function in a Agile squad model with\xa0 small self sufficient teams with a high degree of autonomy, collaboration and fun ! If this interests you, read on.


Using your expertise, you will:


  • Participate in technical design and development discussions to gather insight and contribute to solutions to address user and business requirements;
  • Configure, build (customize), conduct test solutions and integrate or technical architecture components across Salesforce
  • Conduct code reviews and analysis
  • Conduct quality assurance and resolve defects and bugs to satisfaction
  • Engage in regular knowledge sharing and drive continuous improvement
  • Advise and facilitate application development activities in line with established OUA guidelines and industry best practice.

About You :\xa0

With a minimum of 4-6 years of Salesforce platform experience, you will demonstrate:


  • Strong hands on experience with front and back end Salesforce development (Apex, Visualforce, Lightning and other declarative aspects of the Salesforce platform).
  • In-depth knowledge of integration architecture and principles
  • Experience with software development practices in TDD, code refactoring, version control and CI/CD
  • Demonstrated experience implementing Salesforce to integrate with external and internal systems
  • Experience implementing Salesforce DX will be beneficial
  • Strong development background with good experience in at least one programming language is essential. A Java background will be advantageous (but any polygot experience is welcome).
  • Strong grasp of JS Framework eg. React will be valuable
  • Salesforce Certifications (particularly Platform Developer 2 and Architecture Designer) will be viewed favourably.

To fit in with our team, you enjoy working collaboratively, are highly motivated to achieve, exhibit high levels of communication and interpersonal skills, excellent problem solving and analytical capabilities.


What is in it for you?

  • Opportunity to join a growth organisation with a social purpose - where online education is truly transforming student’s lives.
  • Agile working culture being a part of the squad model driven around an aligned mission and\xa0 self sufficient teams\xa0
  • Fantastic and supportive culture
  • Great Location - Melbourne CBD based (Right next to Southern Cross station).
  • Generous Study Assistance policy.
  • Salary packaging benefits


\xa0

To find out more about Open Universities Australia (OUA), please visit our website https://www.open.edu.au.

\xa0

If this piques your interest, please click Apply now\xa0to submit your application or send in an enquiry about the role.

\xa0

Candidates need to hold working rights in order to apply.

\xa0

Please note that we are not accepting third party applications currently.

\xa0

\xa0

Group General Manager Funding and Compliance

Company Name Michael Page Company Location Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 17 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Exceptional opportunity for a commercially focused professional with extensive experience in health fund contract management.


Client Details



St John of God Health Care is a leading provider of high quality health care services in Australia. Established in Western Australia in 1895, they are a not-for-profit private health care group and a ministry of the Catholic Church. With 14,000 staff across Australia, New Zealand and the wider Asia Pacific region, they operate 23 facilities comprising of 3,208 hospital beds in Australia and New Zealand, as well as home nursing, disability services and social outreach programs.



Description


Reporting to the Group Manager Health Funding and Performance, this role sits within the Group Services team based in Melbourne. This role will require strong partnering with the executive teams, private health funds, third party funders and key stakeholders that influence patient outcomes. In doing so, you will engage across a full spectrum of contract negotiation, interpretation, performance and compliance for the St John of God Health Care group of hospitals.


Key duties will include but not be limited to:

  • Planning, developing and managing contract negotiation strategy
  • Identifying opportunities to complement overall relationships and care delivery across the hospitals
  • Build and maintain positive relationships with Health Funds and St John of God.
  • Lead an experienced team of caregivers engaging in decision support strategies
  • Develop and simplify contract rules, payment models and audit expectations
  • Reviewing of data and report writing whilst providing advice/analysis to support decision making
  • Interpret and analyse health data
  • Further develop and implement a standard set of validated benchmarks for contract performance and compliance
  • Identifying prospects for value add generating technologies that will assist with health funding, contracting and compliance.


Profile


The successful candidate will be tertiary qualified with a Masters/Bachelor of Health Sciences or other relevant qualification, with a minimum of 5 years' postgraduate experience. Previous experience in a senior leadership role relating to large health fund contract negotiations, revenue or hospital management will be essential. You will have highly developed influencing/negotiation skills, with an understanding of timeframes, processes and achieving key deliverables. Strong communication skills and experience liaising with executives and senior sector stakeholders will be essential as will strong written and report writing skills. You will not only be a 'subject matter expert' of the health care sector, you will also have a collaborative management style and subscribe to innovation, change and best practice to ensure your team are recognised as 'best in the industry'.




Job Offer

  • Attractive package
  • Salary Sacrificing
  • City Fringe Location
  • Join a leading health care provider
  • Travel to New South Wales, WA and across Victoria.









To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Melanie Wallace-Smith on +61 3 9607 5682

Desired Skills and Experience

Contract manager
Case Mix Manager
Private Health Fund
Hospital Contract Manager

Internet of Things (IoT) Software Engineer

Company Name Bosch Australia & New Zealand Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 141 views

Job description

As one of the world’s leading innovation and technology companies, our Internet of Things (IoT) team develops the next generation of connected solutions for the Mobility, Agriculture and Industry sectors resulting in improved energy consumption of vehicles, more efficient food production etc.. If you are motivated, innovative and excited about working with some of the world’s leading technologies, then a career with Bosch is for you!


About the position


We are currently offering an opportunity for a highly motivated and enthusiastic individual to join us as an IoT Software Engineer. The role is based at our new purpose built headquarters in Clayton, Melbourne.


As an IoT Software Engineer at Bosch your key responsibilities will include:


• Producing requirements from customer and product specifications
• Developing software to customer and product requirements
• Releasing software on time for project deliverables
• Identifying and correcting errors in system behaviour
• Validating implemented requirements

About you


We deliver end-to-end IoT solutions that connect the sensors monitoring “Things” at the edge, through to the cloud based servers and end user APPs. To fulfill the needs of the role you will need to display experience in the following areas:


• Software Development Projects
• Web Service Development (e.g. Java, Spring, Node.js)
• Embedded System Software (e.g. C/C++, Embedded Linux)
• IoT platforms (e.g. Azure IoT, AWS IoT, IBM Watson IoT, Google Cloud IoT)
• Communication technologies (LTE, 6LoWPAN, BLE, Wi-Fi)
• System level understanding of IoT applications and their implementation
• Turning customer concepts into reality with a great user experience
• Using agile development tools such as JIRA and Confluence or similar

You should be able to demonstrate the following:


• A Degree in Engineering, Software, Mechatronics, Electronics, IT or an equivalent
• A valid Australian driver’s license
• A team player mindset with excellent organisational, communication and presentation skills
• Be able to challenge the status quo

The benefits of working at Bosch


We understand that our employees are our greatest asset. Through the diversity of our business, and a commitment to personal and career development, we provide an environment where employees can achieve their full potential.


We offer:


• Diverse and exciting career opportunities, both local and international
• Excellent training and development programs
• Attractive remuneration and benefits
• Flexible working arrangements
• Employee volunteering program and corporate citizenship activities
• Staff discounts on Bosch and affiliated-brand products
• On-site car-parking and canteen facilities


Your application


Bosch values diversity in the workplace and in our recruitment activities. We use a number of tools including blind resumes to work toward eliminating unconscious bias. As such, your resume and cover letter may have your details hidden before being forwarded to a hiring manager.


To apply, please submit your cover letter and resume as one document using Microsoft Word\xa0 through the on-line application link.


As part of your cover letter and resume please include the below information:


• Salary expectation (base rate, excluding super)
• Notice period
• Australian work rights


Please note: You need to be an Australian citizen, or hold Australian work rights, to apply for this role.

About the Opportunity


VAHS\xa0now has a rewarding opportunity for a Family Counselling Service Practice Manager\xa0to join the Family Counselling Service (FCS)\xa0team on a full-time basis, in Melbourne, VIC.


Reporting to the Family Counselling Manager and the Clinical Director, the FCS Practice Manager is responsible for ensuring consistency with VAHS philosophy, policies and best practice standards in the efficient operations of the Family Counselling Clinic.


As the FCS Practice Manager, your day-to-day responsibilities will include (but not be limited to):


  • Liaising with the Family Counselling Manager, Clinical Coordinator and Clinical Director to improve systems, processes and structures so that policies and procedures are developed, documented and implemented;
  • Overseeing patient bookings, the Clinic roster and room allocation to ensure adequate staff coverage to provide services;
  • Maintaining a financially viable practice and an efficient, effective and safe working environment working towards a self-sustaining practice based on Medicare billings;
  • Increasing effective communication between staff and other areas of the service by convening, attending and participating in general and unit staff meetings;
  • Ensuring the correct and appropriate use of MBS items numbers through the provision of education to medical and reception staff; and
  • Leading and implementing policies and procedures within the clinic to ensure all relevant accreditation standards are met.

About the Benefits


This role will see you taking charge of a multidisciplinary team improving social and emotional wellbeing outcomes throughout the wider Aboriginal community.


In return for your hard work and dedication, VAHS\xa0is offering the successful candidate a\xa0competitive remuneration package circa $100,000-$110,000 inclusive of super, negotiable with skills and experience.\xa0Not-for-profit salary sacrificing options are also available to further increase your take-home pay.


You will be joining a collaborative and friendly team who will support you in your onboarding process so you can hit the ground running, and the organisation also encourages ongoing training and development for all employees.

  • Fast-growing, ASX-listed Telco!

The\xa0Commercial Analyst will be responsible for providing research and analytics to the Consumer Product Team and will report to the Head of Commercial Planning.

This role will be responsible for supporting the Product Managers in product roadmap development and pricing strategy through the provision of economic models, pricing elasticity models and customer and market research.
The role will be fundamental in researching and providing insights into existing customers and on new products and/or product innovation that will support the Consumer Product strategy or provide future growth opportunities for the Vocus Consumer business.
This role will work with the wider Product team and with the wider Sales & Marketing team in establishing the customer needs and developing the business cases for the products that meet those requirements.

Key Deliverables:\xa0


  • Economic modelling of product pricing structures and proposed future changes such as price decreases/increases or the introduction of new products

  • Customer experience research and journey mapping
  • Product business case development
  • Supporting Head of Product Commercial Planning in managing delivery of the Product Road Map
  • Supporting the Finance Planning & Analysis team in development and update of the overall Consumer business’ budgets and forecast updates.


Key Skills:

  • SQL
  • Tableau experience
  • Commercial / strategy analysis

839344470:
[

Industry Mentor - Designing Blockchain Solutions

Company Name RMIT Online Company Location 235-251 Bourke Street Building 108, Level 4, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 31 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

RMIT Online is on the lookout for industry Mentors for its online short courses on Designing Blockchain Solutions

\xa0

Are you passionate about blockchain technologies? Looking to impart your knowledge to our short course students, sharing your experience and expertise to help them successfully navigate the world of work? If so, read on!

\xa0

Not your average university – who is RMIT Online?\xa0

\xa0

RMIT Online, a subsidiary of RMIT University is an exciting ‘startup’ team dedicated to building a “Community of lifelong learners, successfully navigating the world of work”. We’re small, nimble, fast-paced and working on really exciting futuristic things.

\xa0

We were created to leverage disruptive innovation in the higher education sector in key local and international markets. With student experience at the forefront of our design, we strive to build world-class online learning experiences with our leading industry partners. And we have a bit of fun along the way.

\xa0

Sounds Good! What’s the role?


A Mentor is an industry professional who is assigned to 20–30 online students, supporting their learning primarily via video conference and instant messaging. You would be employed on a casual basis for approximately 36 hours in total, spread over 9 weeks. \xa0There will be opportunities to continue Mentoring future courses for successful candidates.

\xa0

As a Mentor, you will be responsible for supporting online students to successfully achieve course competency outcomes. You will use your industry knowledge and skills to facilitate learning and student success by guiding, motivating and engaging students through appropriate mentoring approaches. You may also provide career advice based on the students’ course and career goals.

\xa0

This is a paid position and in addition to your hourly rate you will have the opportunity to share your passion, build your professional network with those interested in getting into the industry and raise your personal profile aligned to RMIT Online. You will also develop your coaching and leadership skills as you guide students through their learning journey.

\xa0

Let’s talk about you

Collaborative, engaging, approachable…are just a few words that describe you well.

With outstanding communication and interpersonal skills you have the ability to take what you already know and present it to students in a clear manner to facilitate their learning. Specifically, we’re looking out for someone who has: \xa0

\xa0

  • Solid understanding of core blockchain components and their implementations across multiple platforms
  • Experience designing and evaluating blockchain solutions for clients at an architecture level
  • Industry-standard knowledge and skills in the technical field (experience with Hyperledger Fabric, Sawtooth, Ethereum, Digital Asset or R3 Corda is a bonus!)


  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to drive and support learning engagement and interaction
  • Ability to engage and navigate communication and learning technologies (e.g. Learning Management Systems, Slack, etc.)
  • Previous experience in mentoring or teaching desirable Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to drive and support learning engagement and interaction
  • Industry-standard knowledge and skills in the technical field
  • Ability to engage and navigate communication and learning technologies (e.g. Learning Management Systems, Slack, etc.)
  • Previous experience in mentoring or teaching desirable

\xa0

Ticking your boxes?


Over to you! Drop us a line to fill us in on how you could make a difference as a Mentor. Hit Apply Now or email a copy of your CV and Cover Letter to our mentor Coordinator Hayden Brandford at hayden.brandford@rmitonline.edu.au.


RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community

Member Services Manager

Company Name National Electrical and Communications Association - NECA Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 38 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

NECA (National Electrical and Communications Association) operates in seven state chapters around Australia representing the varying interests of electrical and communications contractors. NECA Victoria, a not-for-profit organisation has been involved in the industry for 100 years and is proud of the contribution and leadership it provides to the industry in representing its members.

NECA through its dedicated staff provide a broad range of services that are an integral key to its members in the operation of their business.

The main purpose of the Member Services Manager is to retain current members whilst signing up new prospective leads. Through delivering an effective and purposeful service to members and membership prospects, the role's focus will be Business Development & Sales and Industry Development.


Key Tasks and Responsibilities

Retention - Responsible for retaining existing members through various purposeful and effective activities & tasks;

  • Member visits and phone calls
  • Attending to member queries and health checks
  • Anticipating renewals and anything that might affect ongoing membership to NECA such as price increases, change in business environment as examples
  • Creating and adding value to member experience by regularly reinforcing and revisiting member value proposition
  • Engaging exiting members so as to understand reasons for leaving so as to act on in the future or document
  • Co-ordinate and actively promote the needs of NECA members to the specialist function e.g. Technical, HSEQ, IR, NECA Education & Careers, Suppliers.
  • Build a knowledge base/profile of each member and their requirements and maintain that information on NECA's customer relations management system (CRM)
  • Create industry events and actively communicate pre and post events


New Member acquisition - Pro-actively identify, develop or create contractor engagement/sales platforms so as to drive leads into new member pipeline such as;

  • Sales events
  • Wholesaler sales packages
  • Direct sales/advertising packages/campaigns
  • Implement acquisition campaigns utilizing NECA events, industry briefings and other activities
  • Identify and actively liaise with any potential members


Industry Development - Speak and present to industry groups and forums

  • In conjunction with other NECA staff identify and co-ordinate promotional opportunities for membership growth
  • Promote the benefits of membership where able
  • Respond to any enquiries regarding information on membership


Skills & Experience

  • Qualifications in business, sales, commerce or other
  • Able to demonstrate previous experience in a membership organisation or similar
  • Able to demonstrate business development and / or sales experience
  • Excellent relationship building skills
  • Established contacts within the electro technology industry - electrical and communications contractors
  • Strong personal organisational and time management skills
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • A proven ability to work within a small team
  • Proven ability to manage a range of projects simultaneously
  • Proven ability in achieving results and working to targets
  • A demonstrated ability to engage with business owners and apprentices
  • A current and valid drivers' licence is a mandatory requirement for this position.


NECA is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud of our diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all sections of the community including Indigenous Australians.

For further information, including a Position Description, please contact Simon Tengende via email simon.tengende@neca.asn.au or by calling 9645 5533.

835980565:
[

Fullstack Developer | MS Tech stack | Remote working

Company Name affix Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 90 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We have partnered with a homegrown Aussie startup focusing on helping businesses consistently deliver great customer experiences every day. I’m pretty pumped about this one. So, without further ado, let me introduce you to RateIt.

The who

RateIt have created an easy and delightful way to gather in-person ratings and NPS to help retailers, healthcare providers and government groups improve their execution and find new growth opportunities. They do this in a way that's easy, delightful and makes a difference. How? I’m glad you asked.

They collect customer ratings via their beautiful tablet app, web app or physical tokens. On the back-end, their customers access insights through an online portal, giving them a clear view of their CX feedback at every interaction.

This is a team who really put their money where their mouth is: they run a super popular podcast (CX Leaders) and are serious about making a name for themselves as the authority in the customer feedback space, with big brand customers from all over the world already singing their praises.

Only having launched in 2016, they have already partnered with some pretty serious brands… Bose, Adidas, BMW, KFC, Fitness First, Harvey Norman, 7/11, just to name a few. And in these first two years, they’ve collected four million ratings and have grown to a team of 30 people! Pretty impressive yes?

The why
They have a proven product which both their public users and B2B customers love to use. Seriously, their engagement stats are kinda nuts. They are solving a real problem and have implemented a business model which is working – so they are well set up for some exciting long-term growth and are on track for a successful Series A.

This team is set up to function remote-first, with staff throughout Australia, a handful of people international and a hub now forming in Melbourne. This is where you come in.

The what
As a full-stack developer, you will join an engineering team of five (and growing) including two experienced full stack devs, one senior front end/UXer, one UI designer and one talented mobile dev. They’re supported by a product manager, a director of product and design and the CTO.

Working on all lines of product, you’ll be involved early in the process from technical, functional and UI/UX requirements through to delivery - building a delightful, high-performance web application. If you’re keen, there are opportunities to get involved in building the mobile apps, continuous integration and DevOps too.

Everyone in this team takes start-to-finish technical ownership of features and/or applications from inception to delivery. They work in a Scrum style, with sprints, retros, standups and an iterative, human-centred approach. Their product process is both data-driven and empathetic, with an emphasis on research and validation over feature factory shipping theatre.

Their tech stack today is a REST services architecture using ASP.NET with component-driven Angular 4 on the front-end. It’s hosted on Microsoft Azure and uses a large number of Azure’s services.

The technical chops you will need… for all you bullet point lovers out there:

  • Proven significant experience working with multiple modern server-side languages including SQL and ASP.NET (or other similar MVC frameworks with enough seniority to transfer across)
  • Demonstrated experience coding in Javascript, particularly with SPA frameworks such as React or Angular
  • Proven understanding and experience in web application architecture, object-oriented software and advanced design patterns would be lovely to have
  • Experience working with a hosted cloud platform and ability to speak to the challenges and benefits, particularly Microsoft Azure
  • Startup experience is highly desirable - if you’re the magic mix of enterprise software and startup dreams, enquire within!


The how
Your role will be 100% remote, with the opportunity to hang out with the Melbourne crew. You can work from home, from the coworking space/new WeWork office, or on the couch with your puppy on your lap. By “remote first” they mean remote team members are first class citizens, and the business is optimised for it: high collaboration, great tools and a strong team culture are guaranteed.

What’s in it for you?

The opportunity to have an impact and leave a legacy. You will have autonomy and you’ll be given a whole lot of growth opportunities. You’ll be working on an interesting product suite with a lot to do, whether it’s shaping process or creating real customer value.

I mentioned high transparency culture; this isn’t just another buzzword tagline. They live and breathe it. RateIt takes staff development seriously, and the autonomy and trust lead to high impact, satisfying work.

What do you want to learn? What are your goals? This might just be the place to be supported and follow those, finally!


Next steps:

Hi \U0001f44b I’m Breanna from affix. We help startups scale up through people. We are lucky enough to be partnering with RateIt to help them grow their brilliant team and business. I have SO MUCH more I can tell you about these peeps but this has gone on long enough already \U0001f606 So it's over to you now. Make sure you apply, but not just “I’ll flick my CV through kind-of-apply” I want to know your story that’s beyond just your CV. Tell me who you are and what you're most proud of that you have delivered and let's see if this is the right home for you.\xa0\U0001f3e1

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 129 views

Job description

  • Full time 12 month fixed term position
  • Supply Chain, Manufacturing Division
  • National Office, St Kilda Road, Melbourne

One in three Australians will need blood in their lifetime. At the Australian Red Cross Blood Service, we’re entrusted with collecting, processing and delivering this vital supply. We also provide a range of other services to the healthcare sector related to transplantation and immunogenetics, testing, consulting, education and research.

We’re proudly in the business of saving lives. Reporting to the National Logistics, Strategy and Project manager and working within a professional and motivated team, you will be responsible for a number of key logistics projects that will drive Supply Chain efficiency improvements at the Blood Service. You will lead best practice ways to do business, including the running of projects from idea through to design, implementation and then completion, ensuring that the change is sustainable.

Your challenge is to support the analysis of the current network to ensure the design is the most cost effective ‘right sized’ network, whilst managing change across a broad range of stakeholders via engagement, well-presented analysis & reporting and strong demonstrated industry knowledge.

You Will Have

  • Tertiary qualification with 5+ years’ experience in logistics operations (transportation and warehousing)
  • Demonstrated experience with transport management systems from tendering through to implementation
  • A proven track record in project leading major change projects
  • Highly developed communication and interpersonal skills with a collaborative working style to drive change management
  • Experience with track, trace and sign on glass technologies
  • Working in an Oracle environment (desirable)

    • You Will Also Be

  • Skilled at providing a financial justification but accompany that with strong engagement, project planning and execution skills
  • Experienced in project management & planning for multiple projects, creating reports, KPI monitoring and system support
  • An influencer, promoting and driving improvement in warehousing and transport performance
  • Great at engaging and liaising with internal and external stakeholders and strong demonstrated experience across supplier management

    • Your Dedication And Hard Work Will Be Rewarded With

  • Pride that your work will impact lives for the better
  • Generous salary packaging benefits
  • Corporate rates for private health insurance

    • As part of the recruitment process, you may be required to participate in relevant National Police, Employment History and/or Professional Membership and Qualification checks and validation of Australian Work Rights, prior to offer of employment at the Blood Service.

Job description

This job is a lot more than only customer support and a lot more than just a job. It’s bit operations, sales and even product development - anything to wow our customers, no rules, no hierarchy. At heart, you will be customer focused and prepared to do whatever takes to support the renting experience of owners and tenants using Cubbi.


Without a doubt, you will gain priceless experience and have a lot of fun in our small startup environment.


Cubbi is an online platform that streamlines the process of renting a property and creates more win-wins for owners and tenants (Common Ground). Thus making a much better renting experience for everyone.


We believe almost any skills can be taught to the person with the right attitude.


The kind of person we’re looking for:


  • Down to earth, relatable and approachable social skills

  • Real desire to make people happy

  • No task too hard or too easy

  • Technically minded - able to assist with basic technical problems

  • A methodical and practical problem solver

  • Renting experience - as a landlord, tenant or industry experience

  • Entrepreneurial mindset and an avid interest in the Cubbi business and brand

  • Adaptable and always actively looking to improve the Cubbi service

  • Desire to lead people and speak your mind



Tasks


Here are a few examples of what you might do in a day:


  • Talk to new owners & tenants about the service on the phone/email or live chat

  • Proactive and reactive support to owners and tenants

  • Tech troubleshooting

  • Follow operational procedures (and update procedures where required)

  • Report customer feedback and be their voice

  • Test new features and provide feedback for improvement

  • Improve our customer support and key metrics



Why Cubbi:

You'll have tons of room to grow and make a big impact. Being part of such a small team that provides a nationwide service you’ll play a really involved role in creating the Cubbi experience. You’ll get to use your skills and creativity to shape Cubbi’s customer support as well as have the opportunity to learn lots of new skills along the way.



Salary:

$55 - 60k plus super



Requirements:

Available to work full time in our office in Cremorne Victoria (right near the MCG or an 8 min walk from Richmond train station).

Potential option to work remotely at times.



To Apply

Use the Easy Apply option and upload a personal message instead of a resume. We’ll have a little peek at your LinkedIn profile.

Job description

Sales Representative

Location: Bayside & South Eastern Suburbs > Melbourne

Worktype: Full Time
Salary: $65000 to $70000
Profession / Role: Engineering + Manufacturing > Sales Executive / Representative

Description

What's in it for you?

On offer is a base salary up to $70,000 + super + trade vehicle + tools + bonuses. Work for this established global supplier of industrial gases as their Business Development Manager based conveniently out of Clayton. This highly autonomous field-based sales role will give you the opportunity to actively target a wide range of businesses across the eastern & south-eastern suburbs of Melbourne who use and need refillable gas cylinders. The business invests heavily in its people by providing regular training and career advancement opportunities for proven performers.

What will you be doing?

Reporting to the Sales Manager, 80% of this role will be to actively target a wide range of businesses across the eastern & south-eastern suburbs of Melbourne who use and need refillable gas cylinders. The secondary responsibility of this role will be to manage, maintain and farm an existing portfolio of customers. My client is ideally looking for candidates with industry experience, however, would definitely consider candidates who have sold products or services into the same businesses that use refillable gas cylinders.

Who will you be working for?

Your potential new employer is a very successful global supplier of industrial gases employing thousands of staff. The company invests heavily in its people by providing ongoing training and offer career advancement opportunities for proven performers.

To Apply For This Role You Must Have
  • A number of years field-based sales experience
  • Previous experience selling a product or service into the same target market
  • Ability to adapt their sales pitch and communication skills depending on the audience
  • Excellent organisational and time management skills


You Are Highly Regarded If You Also Have
  • Currently work as a sales person in the same industry

Job description

Assistant Landscape Officer

  • Permanent Full Time
  • $66K to $78K gross per annum, excluding superannuation

Located in Melbourne’s outer eastern suburbs at the foot of the Dandenong Ranges, Knox City Council is seeking applications for the above position to join our City Planning and Building Team.

Knox City Council aspires to be an organisation which is values based, empowers leaders, enables people to make a difference and has a culture of learning and high performance.

This exciting opportunity to join Knox City Council in a landscape/arboriculture role will assist in helping Knox maintain its green leafy image. The role will see you report to the Coordinator Planning, providing advice on landscape/arboriculture matters to the City Planning and Building team, customers, and the Knox Community.

The successful applicant will be responsible for providing assistance in the assessment of landscaping plans associated with development and subdivision applications, the assessment and processing of tree removal planning applications, the assessment of tree protection measures, and the inspection of vegetation on site.

Suitable qualifications and/or relevant experience in assessing landscaping plans associated with planning applications (preferably within Local Government) and an up to date working knowledge and understanding of Arboriculture practices (including tree health and species identification) are essential. In addition, well developed interpersonal, communication, customer service, problem solving and computer skills are required.

Applications must address the Selection Criteria within the Position Description as attached.

Knox Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion. We are committed to a positive, barrier-free recruitment process. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.

We are…

Signify, the new company name of Philips Lighting, is the global leader in lighting building on 125+ years of innovations.

Our Philips products, Interact connected lighting systems, and data-enabled services transform people’s lives in homes, buildings, and public spaces.

We define the meaning of light…join us to #findyourmeaning @ Signify!

We are continually looking for individuals who share our passion for Lighting and an opportunity now exists for a proactive and energetic individual to join our team as a Key Account Manager.

Together we can…

  • Manage and grow the Signify’s business in the territory with Electrical Wholesalers, Specifiers and Major end users in conjunction with Specification Engineers

845655401:
[

Senior Prize Administration Officer

Company Name Tabcorp Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Our Company

Tabcorp is a world-class diversified gambling entertainment group and an ASX50 company.

In December 2017 we combined with Tatts Group and now operate the iconic brands Tatts, TAB, NSW Lotteries, Golden Casket, SA Lotteries, Keno, Sky Racing and Sky Sports Radio. We also deliver leading gaming services and products through Tabcorp Gaming Solutions, MAX and Ebet.

Our 5,000-plus strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive familiar brands which ignite passion and excitement in millions of Australians.

This leadership is reflected in who we are. If, like us, you’re a passionate, positive playmaker and you want to use your talent to create amazing outcomes, we’d love to hear from you.

Role Summary

This role is responsible for managing the Prize Administration Team for Lotteries in Victoria. A dynamic role that provides the right candidate the opportunity to lead a team of customer centric individuals on a daily basis!

Critical to this role will be your strong communication and interpersonal skills coupled with your business acumen and ability to work well in a team environment. You need to have a positive “can do” attitude and be a self-starter with the discipline to lead a team. We want you to love what you do and bring with a genuine passion for Winning and Lotteries! You will have strong relationship building skills and the ability to manage a high-volume workload in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

Our Ideal Person

You Will Also

With proven success in a Senior Administration role, you will Lead, manage and develop the Prize Administration Officers on a day to day basis, ensuring adherence to procedures and delivery of quality customer service.
  • Implement strategies to optimise the customer experience and services provided.
  • Ensure staff are fully trained in procedures and system functionality.
  • Provide regular feedback to the Prize Administration Team Manager on staff performance and work with the Team Manager to address performance issues.
  • Oversee receipt of customer prize claims and related customer support including enquiries over the counter.
  • Investigate outlet prize payments, claimant integrity and third party requests for information.
  • Oversee and create opportunities for product sales in Queensland, New South Wales and South Australia only.
  • Oversee Central Syndicate management, primarily in Queensland.
  • Authorise prize payments, including old unclaimed prizes, Outlet Prize Claims and Retailer Reimbursements.
  • Administration support as required (potentially across jurisdictions), including but not limited to cheque administration and supervision of lost/damaged ticket searches.
  • Ensure staff adhere to procedures to meet regulatory compliance obligations.
  • Develop and maintain skills and operational knowledge in relation to systems and processes with a view to continual process improvement of work practises.
  • Manage and authorise promotional prize fulfilment.
  • Support complaint handling, resolution and escalations.
  • Support financial administration tasks including verification and authorisation of payments, and purchasing within budget constraints.


You Will Also Bring To The Team
  • Demonstrated experience in leading a team, performing administration and financial management functions and operating within in a highly regulated environment.
  • Intermediate Microsoft Suite Knowledge
  • Customer Centric attitude
  • Strong attention to detail and negotiation skills
  • Well-developed written and verbal communication skills with strong attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Ability to exercise sound judgment in decision making.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and time management Skills
  • The ability to travel interstate from time to time
  • Business or Retail experience is highly desirable.

Please note as of October 2018, the office will be moving to Bowen Crescent, St Kilda!

When you join our team you’ll be able to take advantage of a range of benefits including flexible working arrangements, leadership and development programs and community programs.

Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au.

Full-time
